definition[0]: to be unable to breathe properly because something is in your throat or there is not enough air
example[0]: Six people choked to death on the fumes.
example[1]: He choked on a piece of bread.
definition[1]: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly
example[2]: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
definition[2]: to prevent someone from breathing by putting your hands around their throat and pressing on it
example[4]: His hands were round her throat, choking her.
definition[3]: to be unable to talk clearly because you are feeling a strong emotion
example[6]: I was too choked with emotion to speak.
example[7]: Her voice was choked with rage.
definition[4]: to say something with difficulty because you are very upset or angry
definition[5]: to fill a place so that things cannot move through it
example[10]: The gutters were choked up with leaves.
definition[6]: to fail at doing something, especially a sport, because there is a lot of pressure on you
example[11]: People said I choked, but I just had a bad day on the golf course.
definition[7]: if one plant chokes another, it kills it by growing all around it and taking away its light and room to grow
example[12]: Weeds can quickly choke delicate garden plants.
definition[8]: a piece of equipment in a vehicle that controls the amount of air going into the engine, and that is used to help the engine start
definition[9]: the sound that someone makes when they cannot breathe properly because something is in their throat or there is not enough air
example[13]: She gave a little choke of laughter.
